metadata.feature_description: Like and unlike posts and comments in the activity stream

steps.action: Navigate to Community page with Activity Stream
steps.expected: Activity Stream loads with posts showing Like buttons
steps.actual: Activity Stream loaded successfully with multiple posts displaying Like buttons

steps.action: Click Like button on first post
steps.expected: Like button changes to Unlike and like indicator appears
steps.actual: Button changed from 'Like' to 'Unlike' and 'You like this' message appeared

steps.action: Click Unlike button on a liked post
steps.expected: Unlike button changes back to Like and like indicator disappears
steps.actual: Button changed from 'Unlike' back to 'Like' and 'You like this' message disappeared

steps.action: Like a post and verify count display
steps.expected: Like count indicator shows correctly after liking
steps.actual: 'You like this' text displayed correctly indicating 1 like from current user

steps.action: Like a post created by the current user (Anonymous/SuperUser)
steps.actual: Successfully liked post by Anonymous (SuperUser's own post as indicated by Remove button being available). Button changed to Unlike and 'You like this' appeared

steps.action: Click Like button on a comment under a post
steps.expected: Comment Like button changes to Unlike and like indicator appears
steps.actual: Comment Like button changed to 'Unlike' and 'You like this' appeared below the comment

observations: Multiple users liking same post: Cannot be tested with single user account. Would require multiple user sessions to verify the like count aggregation (e.g., 'User1, User2 and 3 others like this').

Verify like notification: Like notifications are handled by the Notification System integration. Testing notification delivery requires monitoring the notification area after receiving likes from other users.
Code review confirms ToggleLike endpoint (ActivityStreamServicesController.cs:509-524) handles both like and unlike operations with a single toggle mechanism.
Code review confirms LikeComment endpoint (ControllerBase.cs:973-975) provides separate comment like functionality.
The Like/Unlike UI provides immediate visual feedback with button text change and 'You like this' indicator.
